page.title: 19SUNDAY IN BRECHIN
page.content: On most Sundays my family has a long lie in bed until 10 or 11a.m. to recover from the entertainments of Saturday night.We then have a large, proper breakfast of bacon and eggs and toast.There is never time for this on weekdays.All the family then have a read of the papers (Sunday Mail and Sunday Post).In good weather my Dad works in the garden and I lie and sunbathe and listen to the pop music on Radio One. Mum does her housework. If it rains we all watch the film matinee on TV. At 5p.m. we get Sunday dinner ready, usually roast beef, vegtables and potatoes. After we have finished everyone is so full that we sometimes doze off.In the evening I stay at home to have a bath and get ready for school next day. I find Sunday the most boring day of the week.
